oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Snow crystals of great blizzard. Wind south for some time during beginning & first part of storm. Mild night storm began.. Temp +33F. Snow hard all afternoon until 2 o'clock & then became partly clear and soon almost wholly clear.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 185-Hexagonal plate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Snowflakes from cold blizzard. Wind NW. Blowing a gale all the night before. Temp. -7 to -11F. Snowing frosty morning. In afternoon come so many of many very perfect form SM flakes (at 3-4 O'clock. PM.) Dusk 4PM.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 206-Hexagonal plate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Storm from square S of us November. 1898. Between two lows one NE of us the one Great Nov. Blizzard. Nov. 25. 1898. Cirrus S over day before from the south. Low N.clouds over sky most all aft of day before. (Nov. 24) drifting in toward the storm from the N & NW. Temp. Nov. 24, +31F to +29F still. Begin to snow in eve of Nov. 24. Temp. +29F. Upper winds S. lower NW. (snow all night . 8 or 10 Inches.). NW wind blow a gale .

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 181-Hexagonal plate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Great Blizzard from N.C. to Maine. During night nearly a foot of snow fell. 9 inches at least. A NW wind blew hard. Temp was -1F to -3F. Upper clouds moved NW to Se, lower N to S & NW to SE. This was a very famous storm, heavy snowfall from Maine to N.C. Coldest in Washington since great blizzard in Mar. 11, 12 1888. Strong winds, heavy drifting blocked most transportation. Unprecedented cold in south. Below ZERO in AL,MS, TX.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bentley, W. A. (Wilson Alwyn), 1865-1931

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1712-Crystal with broad branches
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Isotherms, or Barometer lines go quite regularly & Parallel in a curve from N to SE. Low N of Quebec, Canada. Jan. 28, 1901. Great Blizzard. Barom. 29.1"Long N & S storm extends from Florida to N of Quebec. Temp.+14F to +8F to +14F. Somewhat windy all day. Increase toward night. Temps. +15F to +19F & back to +14F.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 504-Crystal with broad branches
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Storm from the SW & S. Barometer 29.9 ins. Blizzard Dec. 4, 1901. Large Storm. Temp. +7F to +13F and +11F. After 3 o'clock low N above apparently covered the sky (broken N. Temp +7F. Snowed night previous 4 ins. Temp. fall from +21F to +7F Wind in night N or NW remaining same all day. Stop snowing 5 o'clock. Snow little minute frosty snow succeeding night.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1291-Plate with dendritic extensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Great Blizzard from N.C. to Maine. During night nearly a foot of snow fell. 9 inches at least. A NW wind blew hard. Temp was -1F to -3F. Upper clouds moved NW to Se, lower N to S & NW to SE. This was a very famous storm, heavy snowfall from Maine to N.C. Coldest in Washington since great blizzard in Mar. 11, 12 1888. Strong winds, heavy drifting blocked most transportation. Unprecedented cold in south. Below ZERO in AL, MS, TX.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1760-Plate with dendritic extensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Great blizzard. Temp. +5F 10 +19F to +10F. Windy all day. Snow Hard 8:30 AM to 10 AM and after 2:30 PM to 4:00 PM. Total snowfall of 14 to 16 inches. Clouds not seen except when S was seen at times w/ some low N across W. Moving. N to S. Barom. 29.7 ". Isobars nearly parallel N to S.Shape of storm compact. Reach from Phila.to N of Que. & Atlantic Ocean to Michigan.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bentley, W. A. (Wilson Alwyn), 1865-1931

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1929-Plate with dendritic extensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Cold small storm, apparently local. Temp. +3F to -3F. Lower wind west. Some W breeze. Clouds middle CN or NS. Sky partly clear forenoon. CC & CN clouds . Begin to snow 1 to 1:30. Not snow very hard. Barometer 29.7". Isobars go N to SE. A low existed over Nova Scotia. A high N of the Great Lakes. This storm was apparently divided into two sections. These crystal taken from W edge of storm over NS or from the east edge of the storm reaching W to MI.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1781-Plate with dendritic extensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Great Blizzard). Cont'd. from Nov. 24/25th. Heavy fall of snow from the west. Snow all night previous. Rough. Blustering. Snowfall 6in. Night previous. Temp. go down from +26F to +23F. Strong wind throughout the day Temp. +23F morn. Fall slowly all day to +18F eve. Snowed 6 to 8 in. Barometer 29.5 in.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Weather data: Snow crystals from great still storm. From CR to CC. Thin cloudy morning snow. Light cloudy. Upper current W. , most still. Lower still &E & SE aft. Temp +15F to +25F. Light cloudy all the time. Partly sunny afternoon.
